verses.verse: A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> or <S%H7892>Song<s%> for the <S%H7676>sabbath<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%>. It is a <S%H2896>good<s%> thing to give <S%H3034>thanks<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and to sing <S%H2167>praises<s%> unto thy <S%H8034>name<s%>, O most <S%H5945>High<s%>:
To shew <S%H5046>forth<s%> thy <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>, and thy <S%H530>faithfulness<s%> every <S%H3915>night<s%>, every: Heb. in the nights

Upon an instrument of ten <S%H6218>strings<s%>, and upon the <S%H5035>psaltery<s%>; upon the <S%H3658>harp<s%> with a solemn <S%H1902>sound<s%>. the harp: or, the solemn sound with the harp a solemn: Heb. Higgaion
For thou, <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, hast made me <S%H8055>glad<s%> through thy <S%H6467>work<s%>: I will <S%H7442>triumph<s%> in the <S%H4639>works<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hands<s%>.
O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, how <S%H1431>great<s%> are thy <S%H4639>works<s%>! and thy <S%H4284>thoughts<s%> are <S%H3966>very<s%> <S%H6009>deep<s%>.
A <S%H1198>brutish<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> not; neither doth a <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H995>understand<s%> this.

When the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H6524>spring<s%> as the <S%H6212>grass<s%>, and when all the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%> do <S%H6692>flourish<s%>; it is that they shall be <S%H8045>destroyed<s%> for <S%H5703>ever<s%>:

For, lo, thine <S%H341>enemies<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, for, lo, thine <S%H341>enemies<s%> shall <S%H6>perish<s%>; all the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%> shall be <S%H6504>scattered<s%>.
But my <S%H7161>horn<s%> shalt thou <S%H7311>exalt<s%> like the horn of an <S%H7214>unicorn<s%>: I shall be <S%H1101>anointed<s%> with <S%H7488>fresh<s%> <S%H8081>oil<s%>.

Mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> also shall <S%H5027>see<s%> my desire on mine <S%H7790>enemies<s%>, and mine <S%H241>ears<s%> shall <S%H8085>hear<s%> my desire of the <S%H7489>wicked<s%> that rise <S%H6965>up<s%> against me.
The <S%H6662>righteous<s%> shall <S%H6524>flourish<s%> like the palm <S%H8558>tree<s%>: he shall <S%H7685>grow<s%> like a <S%H730>cedar<s%> in <S%H3844>Lebanon<s%>.
Those that be <S%H8362>planted<s%> in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H6524>flourish<s%> in the <S%H2691>courts<s%> of our <S%H430>God<s%>.
They shall still bring forth <S%H5107>fruit<s%> in old <S%H7872>age<s%>; they shall be <S%H1879>fat<s%> and <S%H7488>flourishing<s%>; flourishing: Heb. green
To <S%H5046>shew<s%> that the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is <S%H3477>upright<s%>: he is my <S%H6697>rock<s%>, and there is no <S%H5766>unrighteousness<s%> <S%H5766><s%> in him.
